text: hello everyone today I'll be showing a
new feature for AWS Network firewall AWS
Network firewall now supports tag-based
resource groups to simplify management
of your firewall rules AWS Network
firewall is a managed firewall service
that makes it easy to deploy essential
Network protections for all your Amazon
virtual private cloud or vpcs with this
launch you can tag and filter AWS
resources to centrally manage and
reference sets of resources in your
stateful firewall rules instead of
manually updating the rule groups every
time you make changes to a set of
resources
you can now organize and tag your ec2
instances and elastic network interfaces
or Enis as a resource Group and
reference a tag in your AWS Network
firewall rule groups referencing tags
for resource groups within AWS Network
firewall rule groups ensures your
firewall rules are applied consistently
as your resources change
previously you needed to manually update
individual Pharaoh rules as you added
deleted or modified your resources which
is time consuming and hard to maintain
now AWS Network firewall automatically
updates a rule group with IP addresses
and cider ranges of the resources in the
resource groups there is no additional
cost to use tag-based resource groups in
AWS Network firewall this feature is
supported in all AWS regions or AWS
Network firewall is available today
including the AWS govcloud U.S regions
let's take a look at how this new
feature looks in the AWS Management
console
I'm going to click on VPC right on the
recently visited you could also click in
the search box and search for vbc
click on VPC
over on the left side you'll see the
network firewall category
you might have to scroll down a bit I'm
going to click on network firewall
resource groups
then click on create Resource Group
now let's give the resource Group a name
call a test Resource Group one
do the same for the optional description
and now we're going to add our list of
resources to the resource Group you can
filter by resource type
either ec2 instances or network
interface
I'm going to add ec2 instances and I can
then select from a list of tags that
have been defined for all the ec2
instances that might account
I'm going to click on the environment
tag
and then all the values for that tag
will show up
so here we have two choices test and
development
I'll select development
then add
and click on preview resources
now I can see which resources will be
part of this Resources Group
and here I see one ec2 instance
if I want to also add the test instances
I can do that as well
when I click on preview resources again
I see an additional instance
here
optionally I can add tags to this
Resource Group here but for this demo
I'll skip that and now that I have all
my resources selected I can click on
create Resource Group all the way down
at the bottom of the page
you can now see that the test Resource
Group has been added and you can refer
to this Resource Group from AWS Network
firewall going forward
for more information on AWS Network
firewall
please go to the network firewall
homepage listed here or see the AWS
Network firewall developer guide Linked
In the description below
hope this update has been helpful and
thanks for watching
